summary: The 'Declaration of Energy Independence Act' amends the Mineral Leasing Act to adjust royalty rates and other regulations for oil and gas extraction on federal lands. Key changes include lowering royalty rates, modifying minimum bid amounts, adjusting rental rates, eliminating a fee for expressing interest, and revising noncompetitive leasing provisions. The bill also addresses reinstatement conditions for leases and clarifies regulations regarding abandoned oil placer mining claims.
